</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Microgiving&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Microgiving (page does not exist)">Microgiving</a> (Direct charitable giving)
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/ONE_campaign" title="ONE campaign" class="mw-redirect">ONE campaign</a><sup id="cite_ref-189" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-189">[188]</a></sup>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Organization_for_Economic_Cooperation_and_Development" title="Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development" class="mw-redirect">Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=United_Nations_Millennium_Campaign&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="United Nations Millennium Campaign (page does not exist)">United Nations Millennium Campaign</a><sup id="cite_ref-190" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-190">[189]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-191" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-191">[190]</a></sup>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/U.S._Agency_for_International_Development" title="U.S. Agency for International Development" class="mw-redirect">U.S. Agency for International Development</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/World_Bank" title="World Bank">World Bank</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=World_Congress_of_Muslim_Philanthropists&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="World Congress of Muslim Philanthropists (page does not exist)">World Congress of Muslim Philanthropists</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/World_Food_Day" title="World Food Day">World Food Day</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/World_Food_Program" title="World Food Program" class="mw-redirect">World Food Program</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=World_Vision&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="World Vision (page does not exist)">World Vision</a>
</li>
</ul>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Col-end&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Col-end (page does not exist)">Template:Col-end</a>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="In_documentary_photography_and_film">In documentary photography and film</span></h3>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Col-begin&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Col-begin (page does not exist)">Template:Col-begin</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Col-1-of-2&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Col-1-of-2 (page does not exist)">Template:Col-1-of-2</a>
</p>
<dl>
<dt>Authors with significant work</dt>
<dd>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Diane_Arbus" title="Diane Arbus">Diane Arbus</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Richard_Avedon" title="Richard Avedon">Richard Avedon</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Jim_Goldberg&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Jim Goldberg (page does not exist)">Jim Goldberg</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Dorothea_Lange" title="Dorothea Lange">Dorothea Lange</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Manuel_Rivera-Ortiz&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Manuel Rivera-Ortiz (page does not exist)">Manuel Rivera-Ortiz</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Sebasti%C3%A3o_Salgado" title="Sebastião Salgado">Sebastião Salgado</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Tom_Stone_(photographer)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tom Stone (photographer) (page does not exist)">Tom Stone</a>
</li>
</ul>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Col-2-of-2&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Col-2-of-2 (page does not exist)">Template:Col-2-of-2</a>
</p>
<dl>
<dt>Significant titles</dt>
<dd>
</dd>
</dl>
<ul>
<li> <i><a href="/wiki/Born_into_Brothels" title="Born into Brothels">Born into Brothels</a></i> (2004)
</li>

</li>
<li> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Streetwise_(1984_film)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Streetwise (1984 film) (page does not exist)">Streetwise</a></i> (1984)
</li>
</ul>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Reflist&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Reflist (page does not exist)">Template:Reflist</a>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Further_reading">Further reading</span></h2>
<ul>
<li>Adato, Michelle &amp; Meinzen-Dick, Ruth, eds. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.press.jhu.edu/books/title_pages/9358.html">Agricultural Research, Livelihoods, and Poverty: Studies of Economic and Social Impacts in Six Countries (2007), </a><a href="/w/index.php?title=Johns_Hopkins_University_Press&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Johns Hopkins University Press (page does not exist)">Johns Hopkins University Press</a><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.press.jhu.edu/books/title_pages/9358.html">, [http://www.ifpri.org/publication/agricultural-research-livelihoods-and-poverty International Food Policy Research Institute</a>
</li>
<li>Anzia, Lys <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://womennewsnetwork.net/2007/08/28/%e2%80%9ceducate-a-woman-you-educate-a-nation%e2%80%9d-%e2%80%93-south-africa-aims-to-improve-its-education-for-girls/">"Educate a Woman, You Educate a Nation" – South Africa Aims to Improve its Education for Girls</a> WNN – Women News Network. 28 Aug. 2007.
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Anthony_Atkinson&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Anthony Atkinson (page does not exist)">Atkinson, Anthony</a>. <i>Poverty in Europe</i> 1998
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Cite_book&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Cite book (page does not exist)">Template:Cite book</a>
</li>
<li> Banerjee, Abhijit &amp; Esther Duflo, Poor Economics: A Radical Rethinking of the Way to Fight Global Poverty (New York: PublicAffairs, 2011)
</li>
<li> Bergmann, Barbara. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dollarsandsense.org/archives/2000/0300bergmann.html">"Deciding Who's Poor"</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=Dollars_%26_Sense&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Dollars &amp; Sense (page does not exist)">Dollars &amp; Sense</a>, March/April 2000
</li>
<li> Betson, David M. &amp; Warlick, Jennifer L. "Alternative Historical Trends in Poverty." <i>American Economic Review</i> 88:348–51. 1998. in JSTOR
</li>
<li> Brady, David "Rethinking the Sociological Measurement of Poverty" <i>Social Forces</i> 81#3 2003, pp.&#160;715–751 Online in Project Muse.<small> Abstract: Reviews shortcomings of the official U.S. measure; examines several theoretical and methodological advances in poverty measurement. Argues that ideal measures of poverty should: (1) measure comparative historical variation effectively; (2) be relative rather than absolute; (3) conceptualize poverty as social exclusion; (4) assess the impact of taxes, transfers, and state benefits; and (5) integrate the depth of poverty and the inequality among the poor. Next, this article evaluates sociological studies published since 1990 for their consideration of these criteria. This article advocates for three alternative poverty indices: the interval measure, the ordinal measure, and the sum of ordinals measure. Finally, using the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Luxembourg_Income_Study&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Luxembourg Income Study (page does not exist)">Luxembourg Income Study</a>, it examines the empirical patterns with these three measures, across advanced capitalist democracies from 1967 to 1997. Estimates of these poverty indices are made available.</small>
</li>
<li> Buhmann, Brigitte, et al. 1988. "Equivalence Scales, Well-Being, Inequality, and Poverty: Sensitivity Estimates Across Ten Countries Using the Luxembourg Income Study (LIS) Database." Review of Income and Wealth 34:115–42.
</li>
<li> Cox, W. Michael &amp; Alm, Richard. <i>Myths of Rich and Poor</i> 1999
</li>
<li> Danziger, Sheldon H. &amp; Weinberg, Daniel H. "The Historical Record: Trends in Family Income, Inequality, and Poverty." Pp.&#160;18–50 in <i>Confronting Poverty: Prescriptions for Change,</i> edited by Sheldon H. Danziger, Gary D. Sandefur, and Daniel. H. Weinberg. Russell Sage Foundation. 1994.
</li>
<li> Firebaugh, Glenn. "Empirics of World Income Inequality." <i>American Journal of Sociology</i> (2000) 104:1597–1630. in JSTOR
</li>
<li> Frank, Ellen, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dollarsandsense.org/archives/2006/0106dollar.html"><i>Dr. Dollar: How Is Poverty Defined in Government Statistics?</i></a> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Dollars_%26_Sense&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Dollars &amp; Sense (page does not exist)">Dollars &amp; Sense</a>, January/February 2006
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Herbert_J._Gans&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Herbert J. Gans (page does not exist)">Gans, Herbert J.</a>, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.sociology.org.uk/as4p3.pdf">"The Uses of Poverty: The Poor Pay All"</a>, Social Policy, July/August 1971: pp.&#160;20–24
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Abraham_George&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Abraham George (page does not exist)">George, Abraham</a>, <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://knowledge.wharton.upenn.edu/india/article.cfm?articleid=4114&amp;specialid=1&amp;CFID=1824805&amp;CFTOKEN=37907590">Wharton Business School Publications – Why the Fight Against Poverty is Failing: a contrarian view</a>
</li>
<li> Gordon, David M. <i>Theories of Poverty and Underemployment: Orthodox, Radical, and Dual Labor Market Perspectives.</i> 1972.
</li>
<li> Haveman, Robert H. <i>Poverty Policy and Poverty Research.</i> Madison: <a href="/w/index.php?title=University_of_Wisconsin_Press&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="University of Wisconsin Press (page does not exist)">University of Wisconsin Press</a> 1987 <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0299111504" class="internal mw-magiclink-isbn">ISBN 0-299-11150-4</a>
</li>
<li> Iceland, John <i>Poverty in America: a handbook</i> University of California Press, 2003
</li>
<li> McEwan, Joanne, and Pamela Sharpe, eds. <i>Accommodating Poverty: The Housing and Living Arrangements of the English Poor, c. 1600–1850</i> (Palgrave Macmillan; 2010) 292 pages; scholarly studies of rural and urban poor, as well as vagrants, unmarried mothers, and almshouse dwellers.
</li>
<li> O'Connor, Alice "Poverty Research and Policy for the Post-Welfare Era" <i>Annual Review of Sociology</i>, 2000
</li>
<li> Osberg, Lars &amp; Xu, Kuan. "International Comparisons of Poverty Intensity: index decomposition and bootstrap inference." <i>The Journal of Human Resources</i> 2000. 35:51–81.
</li>
<li> Paugam, Serge. "Poverty and Social Exclusion: a sociological view." Pp.&#160;41–62 in <i>The Future of European Welfare</i>, edited by Martin Rhodes and Yves Meny, 1998.
</li>
<li> Philippou, Lambros (2010) "Public Space, Enlarged Mentality and Being-In-Poverty", <i>Philosophical Inquiry</i>, Vol. 32, No. 1–2 pp.&#160;103–115.
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Steven_Pressman_(economist)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Steven Pressman (economist) (page does not exist)">Pressman, Steven</a>, <i>Poverty in America: an annotated bibliography.</i> Metuchen, N.J.: Scarecrow Press, 1994 <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0810828332" class="internal mw-magiclink-isbn">ISBN 0-8108-2833-2</a>
</li>
<li> Rothman, David J., (editor). <i>The Almshouse Experience</i> (Poverty U.S.A.: the Historical Record). New York: Arno Press, 1971. <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0405030924" class="internal mw-magiclink-isbn">ISBN 0-405-03092-4</a><small>Reprint of Report of the committee appointed by the Board of Guardians of the Poor of the City and Districts of Philadelphia to visit the cities of Baltimore, New York, Providence, Boston, and Salem (published in Philadelphia, 1827); Report of the Massachusetts General Court's Committee on Pauper Laws (published in [Boston?], 1821); and the 1824 Report of the New York Secretary of State on the relief and settlement of the poor (from the 24th annual report of the New York State Board of Charities, 1901).</small>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/Amartya_Sen" title="Amartya Sen">Sen, Amartya</a> <i>Poverty and Famines: an essay on entitlement and deprivation</i>. Oxford: <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Clarendon Press</a>, 1981
</li>
<li> Sen, Amartya. <i>Development as Freedom</i>. New York: Knopf, 1999
</li>
<li> Smeeding, Timothy M., O'Higgins, Michael &amp; Rainwater, Lee. <i>Poverty, Inequality and Income Distribution in Comparative Perspective.</i> Urban Institute Press 1990.
</li>
<li> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Stephen_C._Smith_(economist)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Stephen C. Smith (economist) (page does not exist)">Smith, Stephen C.</a>, <i>Ending Global Poverty: a guide to what works</i>, New York: Palgrave Macmillan, 2005
</li>
<li> Triest, Robert K. "Has Poverty Gotten Worse?" <i>Journal of Economic Perspectives</i> 1998. 12:97–114.
</li>
<li> Wilson, Richard &amp; Pickett, Kate. <i>The Spirit Level</i>, London: Allen Lane, 2009
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://web.worldbank.org/WBSITE/EXTERNAL/COUNTRIES/SOUTHASIAEXT/0,,contentMDK:21050421~pagePK:146736~piPK:146830~theSitePK:223547,00.html">World Bank: "Can South Asia End Poverty in a Generation?"</a>
</li>
<li> <a href="/wiki/World_Bank_Group" title="World Bank Group">World Bank</a>, "<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://go.worldbank.org/ZPTUFPVPG0">World Development Report 2004: Making Services Work For Poor People"</a>, 2004.
</li>
</ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span></h2>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Sister&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Sister (page does not exist)">Template:Sister</a><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Sister&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Sister (page does not exist)">Template:Sister</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Sister&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Sister (page does not exist)">Template:Sister</a>
</p>
<ul>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://hdl.handle.net/10822/552568">Reducing Global Poverty</a> from the <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://repository.library.georgetown.edu/handle/10822/552494">Dean Peter Krogh Foreign Affairs Digital Archives</a>
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dcp2.org/main/Home.html">Disease control priorities project</a> Studies the cost effectiveness of health care interventions
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.isdb.org/irj/portal/anonymous">Islamic Development Bank</a>
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.lisproject.org/">Luxembourg Income Study</a> Contains a wealth of data on income inequality and poverty, and hundreds of its sponsored research papers using this data.
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.oecd.org/">Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development</a> Contains reports on economic development as well as relations between rich and poor nations.
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://ophi.qeh.ox.ac.uk/">OPHI</a> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Oxford_Poverty_%26_Human_Development_Initiative&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Oxford Poverty &amp; Human Development Initiative (page does not exist)">Oxford Poverty &amp; Human Development Initiative</a> (OPHI)] Research to advance the human development approach to poverty reduction.
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.transparency.org/">Transparency International</a> Tracks issues of government and corporate corruption around the world.
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.un.org/english">United Nations</a> Hundreds of free reports related to economic development and standards of living in countries around the world, such as the annual <i>Human Development Report.</i>
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.rogalinski.com.pl/jezyki-obce/english/european-commissioner-there-is-a-tendency-to-evict-the-poor/">European Commissioner: There is a tendency to evict the poor</a>
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.usaid.gov/">U.S. Agency for International Development</a> USAID is the primary U.S. government agency with the mission for aid to developing countries.
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.worldbank.org/">World Bank</a> Contains hundreds of reports which can be downloaded for free, such as the annual <i>World Development Report.</i>
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.wfp.org/">World Food Program</a> Associated with the United Nations, the World Food Program compiles hundreds of reports on hunger and food security around the world.
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.whypoverty.net/">Why poverty</a> Documentary films about poverty broadcast on television around the world in November 2012, then will be available online.
</li>
<li> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.oxfam.org/en/pressroom/pressrelease/2013-01-19/annual-income-richest-100-people-enough-end-global-poverty-four-times">Annual income of richest 100 people enough to end global poverty four times over</a>. <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Oxfam_International&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Oxfam International (page does not exist)">Oxfam International</a>,</i> 19 January 2013.
</li>
</ul>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Social_class&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Social class (page does not exist)">Template:Social class</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Africa_topic&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Africa topic (page does not exist)">Template:Africa topic</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Americas_topic&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Americas topic (page does not exist)">Template:Americas topic</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Asia_topic&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Asia topic (page does not exist)">Template:Asia topic</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Europe_topic&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Europe topic (page does not exist)">Template:Europe topic</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Oceania_topic&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Oceania topic (page does not exist)">Template:Oceania topic</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:RC_consecrated_life&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:RC consecrated life (page does not exist)">Template:RC consecrated life</a>

</p>
